items.longDescription:
Keith Haring X Coca-Cola®

The Keith Haring × Coca-Cola story brings together two American pop culture icons. During his lifetime, Keith Haring created artwork featuring the iconic Coca-Cola logo. He loved Coca-Cola, what it represented, and would even personalize Coca-Cola cans in his signature art style when his friends visited his studio. Enjoy the special designs available only at UNIQLO.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,” with abstract marks and patterning.

© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
©The Coca-Cola Company. All Rights Reserved.

items.longDescription:
MAGNUM PHOTOS

The artist Coco Capitán, born in 1992, has curated works from Magnum's archive centered on the theme of cats. Coco, an artist with global recognition for her photography and handwritten aphorisms, pairs her quotes with each cat-themed photo, crafting a collection that tells new stories through each feline motif.


© Coco Capitán 2025
© Magnum Photos

items.longDescription:
Lee Ufan

Curated by Tate

Tate is a family of four art galleries: Tate Britain, Tate Modern, Tate Liverpool, Tate St Ives. We care for and display the national collection of modern and contemporary art from around the world and British art from 1500 to today. UT and Tate have chosen works by artists in Tate’s collection who express themselves through paint. Let this UT series curated by Tate inspire you to get creative.

Lee Ufan was born in South Korea and lives and works worldwide, based in Japan and Paris. His works are characterized by a sense of infinity through the restriction of colour and action. In his work ‘From Line’, he uses the monochromatic colour blue. “At the beginning, it will appear dark and thick, then it will get gradually thinner and finally disappear,” said the artist.

© Cy Twombly Foundation, © Tate 2024
items.name: TATE UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.freeInformation:
- The images shown may include colors that are not available.

items.longDescription:
Cy Twombly

Curated by Tate

Tate is a family of four art galleries: Tate Britain, Tate Modern, Tate Liverpool, Tate St Ives. We care for and display the national collection of modern and contemporary art from around the world and British art from 1500 to today. UT and Tate have chosen works by artists in Tate’s collection who express themselves through paint. Let this UT series curated by Tate inspire you to get creative.

Cy Twombly was an American artist who spent most of his career in Italy. His signature paintings feature colourful marks scribbled and smeared on canvas. Fascinated by the cultures of ancient Greece and Rome, Twombly was inspired by history, mythology and poetry. The act of painting, he once said, could come out of “one ecstatic impulse.”

© Cy Twombly Foundation, © Tate 2024
items.name: TATE UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.longDescription:
Jackson Pollock

Curated by Tate

Tate is a family of four art galleries: Tate Britain, Tate Modern, Tate Liverpool, Tate St Ives. We care for and display the national collection of modern and contemporary art from around the world and British art from 1500 to today. UT and Tate have chosen works by artists in Tate’s collection who express themselves through paint. Let this UT series curated by Tate inspire you to get creative.

American artist Jackson Pollock was a key figure in the abstract expressionist movement, famous for his action or ‘drip’ paintings. To create these, he placed his canvas on the ground and poured, flung, or trailed paint around it as he moved. Pollock said this process gave each work ‘a life of its own.’

© Cy Twombly Foundation, © Tate 2024
items.name: TATE UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.freeInformation:

items.longDescription:
Fahrelnissa Zeid

Curated by Tate

Tate is a family of four art galleries: Tate Britain, Tate Modern, Tate Liverpool, Tate St Ives. We care for and display the national collection of modern and contemporary art from around the world and British art from 1500 to today. UT and Tate have chosen works by artists in Tate’s collection who express themselves through paint. Let this UT series curated by Tate inspire you to get creative.

Zeid made this painting when she was living in London in the 1950s. In 1949, she had taken her first transatlantic flight and was captivated by the abstract perspective of aerial views. She later translated their scale and feeling into the whirling shapes that appear in this painting. A divisionist effect is achieved, whereby individual patches of colour are built up to create an overall composition.

© Cy Twombly Foundation, © Tate 2024
items.name: TATE UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-shirt)

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
*Purchases for resale are strictly prohibited.
